mmOrderMarking.Description: Adding numbering to the specified parameter of elements with the possibility of numbering in the schedules
mmOrderMarking.FullDescription: When working in a non-schedule view, you can specify the direction of numbering based on the arrangement of elements, or add numbering in the order in which elements were created. When working in a schedule, the plugin adds numbering in the order of items in the schedule (taking into account sorting). It is possible to set the prefix and suffix for the number
mmOrderMarking.h15: has the "Read Only" property for the following elements
mmOrderMarking.h16: It is not possible to change the instance parameter for an element located in a group if the parameter "Values can vary by group instances" is not enabled for the parameter or it is not the "Mark" system parameter
mmOrderMarking.h17: Errors occurred while changing the parameter values of the listed items
mmOrderMarking.h18: Attention! The parameter is cleared for all elements of this schedule, regardless of the filtering settings. This means that if, for example, 10 columns are presented in the schedule, and only 5 columns are displayed in the filter settings, then the parameter will be cleared for all 10 columns! Clear parameter?
mmOrderMarking.h28: The "{0}" parameter has a "Read-only" property. Make sure that the elements to be processed are not in a Workset that is not available to you for editing
mmOrderMarking.h43: Enter the letters of the alphabet without spaces in any case. You can also
mmOrderMarking.t1: The work of the plugin is possible only in the schedule in the sorting settings of which the property "Itemize every instance" is checked
mmOrderMarking.t3: Standard frame selection – selection of elements in the current view with a frame with confirmation of the selection by pressing the "Finish" button. With this option, the numbering direction has nine options – in the order of creation and by the position of the elements.
mmOrderMarking.t4: Ordinal selection – selects each element for numbering in the order in which the numbering will be performed. With this option, the direction of numbering can be ascending or descending. Completion of the selection is invoked by pressing the Esc key.
mmOrderMarking.t5: Curve intersection – Select a curve (model line or detail line). The elements for numbering will be selected by finding the intersection of the curve with the geometry of the elements in the current view, projected onto the plane of the view. With this option, the direction of numbering can be ascending or descending.
mmOrderMarking.t6: It is possible to apply a filter by category and/or parameters to all element selections.
mmOrderMarking.t7: The list of parameters is filled in after selecting the elements for numbering.
mmOrderMarking.t12: The initial value can be a fractional value. A point or comma can be used to separate the integer part from the fractional part. The specified separator will be used when setting values in the text parameter. If the target parameter is of data type "Number", the specified separator will not affect the displayed result. If the target parameter is of data type "Integer", the numbering result will be converted to an integer by discarding the fractional part.
mmOrderMarking.t13: Leading zeros can be added to the initial value. For example, if the initial value is "01", and the step is "5", then the numbering result will be "01, 05, 10, 15...". Initial zeros are only taken into account if the target parameter has a string data type.
mmOrderMarking.t14: The geometric direction of numbering is calculated by the absolute values of X and Y of the element placement points. For linear objects the middle point is taken
mmOrderMarking.t15: When sorting linear objects, the center point is used. When sorting viewports, the center of the viewport is used. When sorting tags, the header placement point is used. In other cases, the insertion point of the element is used
mmOrderMarking.t16: You can apply letter numbering. To do this, specify the letter of the alphabet from which the alphabetic numbering will start as the initial value. Alphabetic numbering will be performed in the same case in which the initial value is specified.

mprSheetRenumber.Description: Plugin allows to renumber sheets in the project
mprSheetRenumber.FullDescription: Renumbering of sheets is carried out within one group of sheets. You can display all sheets by analogy with the current settings of the project manager or display all sheets in one group. There is an opportunity to change the position of sheets by moving them in the group, while maintaining the initial numbering of sheets in this group
mprSheetRenumber.m1: To launch plugin go to the project
mprSheetRenumber.m2: Available in the full version of the plugin
mprSheetRenumber.h3: Sheet number is already used in the project!
mprSheetRenumber.h5: The position of the sheets does not match the position of the sheets in the Project Browser
mprSheetRenumber.h9: The initial value for the numbering of sheets in the group
mprSheetRenumber.h11: Start numbering from the selected sheet in the group
mprSheetRenumber.h12: Disable display results of intermediate renumbering
mprSheetRenumber.h13: Enable display results of intermediate renumbering
mprSheetRenumber.h15: Renumber sheets in a group according to the specified settings
mprSheetRenumber.h16: Renumbering by moving allows you to swap sheets in the group, while maintaining the original numbering in the group
mprSheetRenumber.h17: Extended numbering settings for a group
mprSheetRenumber.h18: You can create a scheme for the numbers of sheets using the three configurable parts and dividers between them. In each part, you can specify the prefix, suffix and number. The number can be made static or dynamic (increasing or decreasing). The whole sheet number, part or part number can be written to the specified parameter
mprSheetRenumber.h22: You must select at least one part
mprSheetRenumber.h31: The upper limit of the number when decreasing. This is the number from which numbering will start, reaching zero
mprSheetRenumber.h33: You can add leading zeros to the sheet number. To do this, set the minimum length of the line representing the sheet number. For example, if the sheet number is 15 and you set the length to 3, the result will be 015. To avoid adding leading zeros, set the length to 1

mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.Description: Batch elements copying to the opened documents
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.FullDescription: Batch copying of the current document's selected elements to the specified opened documents
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.h8: Expand all positions to the second nesting level
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.h23: Specifies the behavior when the names of related elements match. For example, if a wall instance is copied and the target document already has a wall type with the same name as the copied wall, Revit suggests using the target document type or creating a copy of the type with a numeric suffix.
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.h24: This option does not affect most elements copied by the plugin, but must be set in the copy method used from the Revit API. Most elements are copied with the addition of a numeric suffix regardless of the value of this option.
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.h25: If the type names match and the "Replace" option is selected, the plugin will perform the following algorithm: in the target document, a type name with the same name as the copied type name (the old type name) will be renamed. Then the new type will be copied. The new type will be assigned to all instances of the elements to which the old type was assigned. The old type will be deleted.
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.h26: If the filter names match and the "Replace" option is selected, the plugin will perform the following algorithm: in the target document, it will find all the views and view templates to which a filter with the same name as the filter to be copied (the old filter) has been applied. Then the new filter will be copied, with the addition of a numeric suffix. For all previously found views and view templates, the filters will be reapplied, replacing the old filter with the new filter, but keeping the visibility settings intact. The old filter will be deleted. The new filter will be given the name of the old filter.
mprCopyElementsToOpenDocuments.h27: If the view names match and the "Replace" option is selected, the plugin will perform the following algorithm: in the target document it will find all viewports that translate the old view, or all views that use the old view as a template (if the view to be copied is a template). The new view will then be copied, with a numeric suffix added. For all previously found views, the new view will be set as the translated view, or for all previously found views, the new view will be set as a template. The old view will be deleted. The new view will be given the name of the old view.

mprContextFilter.Description: Filter elements by parameters, which works as a context menu
mprContextFilter.FullDescription: The filter is launched in one of three ways: by left-clicking the mouse while holding down the Ctrl key, by sequential pressing of keys, or by pressing a key combination. The filter has three processing levels – all elements of the model, elements in the current view, or selected elements. There is the ability to use presets for quick filter use

mprBreakLayers.Description: Breaking multilayer walls and floors into separate elements
mprBreakLayers.h7: Changing the settings is available in the full version
mprBreakLayers.t1: If "Last layer above wrap" is selected, but there are no layers above wrap, the top layer of the core will be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t2: If "Last layer below wrap" is selected, but there are no layers below wrap, the bottom layer of the core will be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t3: If the option "Structural material" is selected, but there is no layer with this option, the largest layer of the core will be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t4: If the largest layer of the core is not found, the largest layer of all layers will also be taken.
mprBreakLayers.t5: With break option "By core edge" the options "Structural material" and "Core biggest layer" take into account the properties of the initial layers of the element.
